*'''Producer Matt Myers (aka Valdez)''': named show producer in July 2009. Grew up in [[Pasadena, Maryland]] and graduated from the [[University of Maryland]].
*'''Producer Matt Myers (aka Valdez)''': named show producer in July 2009. Grew up in [[Pasadena, Maryland]] and graduated from the [[University of Maryland]].
â
*'''Kevin "BDK" McCarthy''' Reviews movies weekly on the show. He has also been known to give himself fellatio in-studio.
+
*'''Kevin "BDK" McCarthy''' Reviews movies weekly on the show.
*'''Former Executive Producer Chris Kinard (a.k.a. CK):''' Has been with the show since 1998 as an intern, named producer in 1999. He moved with the show to WHFS in 2002, and back to WJFK in 2005. Kinard grew up in [[Fairfax Station, VA]] and attended [[Lake Braddock Secondary School]] and [[American University]].<ref name="jw01"/> He is WJFK's Program Director and relinquished his producing duties after the station's format change in July 2009.<ref name="jw01">[http://www.wjfk.com/pages/287693.php WJFK Official Web Site, "TalkBack to 106.7 WJFK"]</ref>
*'''Former Executive Producer Chris Kinard (a.k.a. CK):''' Has been with the show since 1998 as an intern, named producer in 1999. He moved with the show to WHFS in 2002, and back to WJFK in 2005. Kinard grew up in [[Fairfax Station, VA]] and attended [[Lake Braddock Secondary School]] and [[American University]].<ref name="jw01"/> He is WJFK's Program Director and relinquished his producing duties after the station's format change in July 2009.<ref name="jw01">[http://www.wjfk.com/pages/287693.php WJFK Official Web Site, "TalkBack to 106.7 WJFK"]</ref>
==History==
==History==
â
Auville, Bickel, and Flaim grew up as friends in Bowie, Maryland. Auville and Flaim attended Eleanor Roosevelt High School; at the same time, Bickel met Bishop at DeMatha Catholic High School. Bickel and Flaim also attended the University of Maryland together. During summer vacation, the crew would go camping and invite their friend Jeff Smoker to come and hang out.
+
Auville, Bickel, and Flaim grew up as friends in Bowie, Maryland. Auville and Flaim attended Eleanor Roosevelt High School; at the same time, Bickel met Bishop at DeMatha Catholic High School. Bickel and Flaim also attended the University of Maryland together. After graduating from college, the foursome and other friends hung out and often shared living quarters. In 1995, the four began their broadcasting career as a hobby with a 30-minute cable access show in Bowie featuring sports chat and irreverent humor.
â   â
After graduating from college, the foursome and other friends hung out and often shared living quarters. In 1995, the four began their broadcasting career as a hobby with a 30-minute cable access show in Bowie featuring sports chat and irreverent humor.
 
The show focused on the interplay of the foursome, featuring guests such as [[Playboy]] models, rock notables, and local sports celebrities such as University of Maryland basketball coach [[Gary Williams]]. Their high local ratings lead to their national debut on May 18, 1999, airing on about 50 affiliates of [[Westwood One]]'s radio network.<ref name="ss61999">[http://www.junksweb.com/news/EEVkupZZVEUrBMqOug.shtml "Called up to 'The Show'" ''Street & Smith's Sports Business Journal'' article (06/07/21999)]</ref> That syndication was short lived however. {{Citation needed|date=March 2008}}
The show focused on the interplay of the foursome, featuring guests such as [[Playboy]] models, rock notables, and local sports celebrities such as University of Maryland basketball coach [[Gary Williams]]. Their high local ratings lead to their national debut on May 18, 1999, airing on about 50 affiliates of [[Westwood One]]'s radio network.<ref name="ss61999">[http://www.junksweb.com/news/EEVkupZZVEUrBMqOug.shtml "Called up to 'The Show'" ''Street & Smith's Sports Business Journal'' article (06/07/21999)]</ref> That syndication was short lived however. {{Citation needed|date=March 2008}}
